subject: JUnit and test data
msgSnippet: I have a bunch of tests that need to be run against test data. There is a lot of test data and I need it to be loaded in an hierarchical fashion. For example,

I have a bunch of tests that need to be run against test data.

There is a lot of test data and I need it to be loaded in an
hierarchical fashion.

For example, things are kind of setup like this, starting with the
base directory 'test/'.

test/
     global.data
     test_type1/
                type1.data
                test1/
                      test1.data
                      Test1.java
                test2/
                      test2.data
                      Test2.java
     test_type2/
                type2.data
                test1/
                      test1.data
                      Test1.java
                test2/
                      test2.data
                      Test2.java

I want to be able to run individual tests, all tests of a given type
and all tests of every type.  If I want to run all the tests, then
global.data should only be loaded once.  type1.data should be only
loaded once and accessible for all tests of type1, then unloaded when
all type1 tests are done.  Then type2.data gets loaded (only once)
while needed and then unloaded.

I was going to use TestSetup, to do the extra setup for me, but where
do I store the data?  I can't store it in a subclass of TestSetup,
because then the Test contained by TestSetup won't have access to the
data.  Is there a general way of doing this type of thing?  In fact,
more generally, JUnit doesn't seem to have any concept of test data. 
All examples and documents I've seen assume that the data can be
hard-coded into the test itself, which is not always practical.  Are
there generally accepted ways of loading data (and hierarchies of data)?

Thanks much in advance.
Jacob
